result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

9:35 AM Defendant Kevin Allen Helwig in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Kevin Allen Helwig.  Attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:47 PM Defendant Kevin Allen Helwig appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video for Kevin Allen Helwig.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Dan Schoonover sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects with argument. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendants Attorney stands mute; Court enters a not guilty plea and jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
Notice of Hearing for Return on Warrant on September 19, 2022 at 1:00pm, NOT DELIVERABLE AS ADDRESSED, UNABLE TO FORWARD, RETURN TO SENDER (Defendant Kevin Allen Helwig)
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

3:51 PM Defendant Kevin Allen Helwig appeared by video, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video for Kevin Allen Helwig.  Attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Court orders $5000 cash bond with same conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of Drug Paraphernalia. Court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022.
Original warrant returned September 15, 2022
